Key Arguments: The bill is authoritarian and Marxist in character.
It imposes censorship and monitoring on public speech.
The bill divides citizens into two classes, favoring government-approved entities.
It intimidates both digital platform providers and ordinary citizens.
The legislation is too costly to administer equitably.
It threatens religious freedom and lacks adequate definitions.
The bill will have a chilling effect on free speech.
Free speech is a more effective solution for misinformation.
The bill could breach the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child.
It will lead to pre-censorship by digital platforms.
Indigenous knowledge might be unfairly classified as misinformation.
The bill could have catastrophic public health implications by stifling knowledge evolution.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is authoritarian and Marxist in character and must be withdrawn.
This Bill stands to fundamentally alter my quality of life as an Australian citizen.
Free speech is extremely important. Western society has rarely existed without it.
This legislation will have a chilling effect on Free Speech.
The censorship and intimidation that will follow the enactment of Misinformation legislation will kill this process at Step 1.
